website_summaries.verdict: This is a good option for those who want an alternative to a gas-powered chainsaw that provides a consistent, powerful cutting action.
pros: Corded electric chainsaw offers a consistent amount of power
Handle wraps around so you can choose the most comfortable way to hold it
cons: Some users have complained about the chain being too loose and the difficulty of tightening it

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY. DO NOT BUY. DO NOT BUY.
customer_reviews.text: Joey (prior reviewer) got it exactly right. Either the chain flies right off the bar, or it comes loose off the bar after going through one branch. Tension knob is useless without the help of plyers! Tension rod is a joke. I have wasted so much time with this thing. Unfortunately it's too late for me to return. Argh!
customer_reviews.author: colleenesh

customer_reviews.title: PIECE OF CRAP
customer_reviews.text: The chain kept coming off despite the fact that I went online to look at the video on how to adjust the chain. I ordered it follow the instructions on how to tighten the chain on the chainsaw and after I will adjust it it would cut maybe V cuts and then the train will come off again. It's a piece of crap I've only had a six months and I just threw it in the trash
customer_reviews.author: Valerie Bone

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy!! unless you like frustration
customer_reviews.text: Do not buy!! unless you like frustration and wasting time. The chain constantly keeps coming off (right out of the box) and I spent more time putting it back on than getting any work done with it. I found several reviews that stated this has happened to them but thought they must have not adjusted the chain correctly. I was wrong, I should have believed them. I have owned chainsaws for many years and have never had this issue so I do know how to adjust the chain. Lucky I used this before the return window closed or else it would be going in the trash.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Great Chain Saw
customer_reviews.text: I GOT THIS chain saw because of the ratings. I received it on time and I used it right away to cut some branches in our back yard. Most of them were 3' in diameter. The saw was great it is powerful and very easy to use and perfect weight. It did the job flawlessly. Make sure to clean the saw when done and wipe off the lubricated oil. Easy to clean. I strongly recommend this chain saw. And the price is great too. Very pleased!
customer_reviews.author: Ed V.

customer_reviews.title: Great power! Sadly, very dull chain.
customer_reviews.text: Gave this as a gift and son says it’s amazing so just ordered one for myself. Update: 4/18- after using it for a total of 10 min one day cutting 4x4s and tree limbs, the next day he tried to use it the chain was completely acting dull and came off twice in a matter of minutes even after tightening the tension. I’m returning it. I just bought myself one so hopefully I don’t run into the same issues. The Consumer reviews were good for this. Disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: jessica

customer_reviews.title: Powerful, easy to use, recommended!
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to quickly get this posted in case someone is considering this saw. It is terrific! I needed to cut down some trees in my yard that had a maximum trunk diameter of about 8 inches. It took only seconds to do, and very smoothly and relatively quietly as well. I also had to cut a great deal of branches and found the size of the saw was perfect. It is easy to use, powerful, and can be used for some pruning and shaping tasks as well as heavier tasks.
customer_reviews.author: Buyer in Hawaii

customer_reviews.title: I love this thing!
customer_reviews.text: We have used this chainsaw for HOURS, chopping down trees, limbs, etc. in our yard. When we bought our house, the yard had really been let go for quite some time. This chainsaw made quick work of getting the yard back under control. It is light weight enough that anyone could use it. I really like the quick-stop feature, as it makes me feel more safe when using it. Don’t doubt that an electric chainsaw can do the trick, because this thing is GREAT!
customer_reviews.author: EmilyDB

customer_reviews.title: Be careful when using this saw!
customer_reviews.text: The saw worked fine until I let go of the trigger and the saw kept going and cut a branch that fell on my arm. This brought the saw very close to cutting off my fingers. This was unexpected and occurred due to the on/off trigger button getting stuck. The electrical cord can also get tangled and cause issues when cutting branches. I would recommend the cordless version for safety no matter the price. Be very careful when using this saw and only use for small jobs. Ok, that's my good Samaritan work for the day.
customer_reviews.author: Ron Jenkins

customer_reviews.title: Does the job
customer_reviews.text: This little chainsaw did its job and helped me cut down a few trees and cut up broken limbs. I used vegetable oil as a chain lube, my research revealed that most chain oils are not environmentally friendly. The one minor negative is the cord retaining system, the loop and hole provided are far too small to use a cord that is rated for the amps this kit can pull. My solution was to just loop the cord through the handle and tie a know, it works, just not elegant. Overall a good value and seems to be fairly well made.
customer_reviews.author: Bret Spangler

customer_reviews.title: Improvements Needed For The Knowns.
customer_reviews.text: Other reviews correct about chain falling off. No complaints for adding chain lube cleaning rasp out & tightening chain regularly. The power for this electric chain saw seems good. All being said with adjustments between cuts and than the chain comes off its annoying. Plan to spend alot of time on said. It was purchased & used for light duty if I worked it harder it would go back. Manufactures need to respond promptly when told about these concerns and not keep selling without fixing the issues.
customer_reviews.author: EXPEDITION

customer_reviews.title: what every woman needs!
customer_reviews.text: Growing up watching my dad cut firewood every year, I can say I have a respect for this type of machinery! I also realized this can't be too difficult! I opted to try this myself instead of paying someone. While I am certain many men would scoff at this, it is exactly what I was looking for! enough power to cut what I need (I won't be falling the huge trees in the forest), and lightweight! Took out of box, added oil, adjusted chain - and was ready for my fun/productive afternoon!
customer_reviews.author: Chris V

customer_reviews.title: This unit is great for my branches and small trees in places where ...
customer_reviews.text: My 14" gas powered chain saw is officially for sale. Wish I ordered this electric in the first place. The noise and problems getting it started are gone. This unit is great for my branches and small trees in places where there is electric power. The one gripe is the chain doesn't seem to like to stay tight and when you are working with small stuff it pops off pretty regularly. The good part is it's easy to tighten and put back on.
customer_reviews.author: J. bracco

customer_reviews.title: Nice saw!
customer_reviews.text: I have yet to run it, but thought I'd get a jump start on a review. The ad states "9 Amps", and that is why I bought it, for my small generator won't handle any more draw than that. Well, it is 10.5 amps, which puts a stop to my plans to use the generator! It is a fine looking piece of equipment though, so I'll keep it. Very impressive for the price, and for even double the price! I expect this saw will not disappoint!
customer_reviews.author: Robert Daniel Pinto

customer_reviews.title: My husband & I thought that this would be great for both of us to use
customer_reviews.text: Saw has a oil leak & chain will not stay on . My husband & I thought that this would be great for both of us to use, lite weight and not pull start, but needless to say it isn't !!!!! Only use the saw twice for about 20 mins total because of the issues. Purchased April 7,2017 and May 10,2017 when to Home Depot to purchase another saw.
customer_reviews.author: bjvfam

customer_reviews.title: This product is awful
customer_reviews.text: This is a piece of junk. After one month the chain will NOT stay on the unit. The number for Greenworks keeps hanging up before it even rings. Amazon says the product is ineligible for return. This is the worst product I have EVER gotten from Amazon. And there is no number to call Amazon. I left an email with Grennworks and have not heard back. And where did it say that after one month I can not return it?
customer_reviews.author: Rosemary B. Vullo

customer_reviews.title: My father-in-law told me about his 14 inch Greenworks and how easy it was to use and I saw this online ...
customer_reviews.text: My Poulan Pro 220 was gummed up and not running right. My father-in-law told me about his 14 inch Greenworks and how easy it was to use and I saw this online and decided it was worth a try. I have been thoroughly impressed. It literally cut through 12 and 14 in trunks like butter. Highly recommend. Pictures attached.
customer_reviews.author: pnaplace

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this product to take down two trees on my property. I have owned gas operated chainsaws in the past but don’t want to deal with them any longer. I received this chainsaw, read the manual, filled the chain oil reservoir and went to work. So far, it has worded great. I am very happy with the performance and for a few decent size jobs, I would recommend this product. I do not know how it will hold up but only time will tell. Very pleased!!
customer_reviews.author: Chris Bowen

customer_reviews.title: Nice Chain Saw
customer_reviews.text: Great for home owner projects. Medium size branch trimming/pruning. Not for taking down an entire big tree. Quiet and easy to use. Good quality and enough power. Have trimmed oaks, maples and crabapples. 3-4" branch diameters. Breezes right through each wood. Use good chain saw safety and practices "please" with any type saw, gas or electric. My rating doesn't consider using these type tools poorly. Read the owners manual. Understand how to trim trees and the forces of gravity.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth

customer_reviews.title: Poorly designed saw
customer_reviews.text: Poorly designed sprocket allows chain to easily slide off which subsequently causes chain to come off bar during normal operation. I know how to ensure the chain is adequately tightened, so this is not an operator error. The tightening bar control apparatus appears to barely hold bar in place so I imagine over a very short time this will wear out. Used it for 30 minutes (about 5 of those minutes actually running the saw as most time was spent putting the chain back on!) and was ready to ship back as I consider this a safety hazard with the chain continuously flying off.
customer_reviews.author: Bobby

customer_reviews.title: I dominated my yard!
customer_reviews.text: This little guy is a beast! I’m so happy I bought this. I conquered a small jungle in my backyard. I cut down multiple trees around the 4-8 inch diameter and didn’t get bogged down once. It’s super easy to tension the chain and clean the saw. The saw is light and easy to wield in tight spots. The cord holder makes it easy to keep the cord out of the way and keep from unplugging it on accident. I also like that the replacement chains are reasonably priced. I highly recommend this to anyone with a yard to maintain!
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: Nice chainsaw
customer_reviews.text: It cuts really well but the chain keeps popping off I just can't tell you how many times I had to put the dang thing back on and I know what I'm doing I've had chainsaws for years I've been cutting wood for years so I know what I'm talking about when the team doesn't stay on and this one does not stay on but it's a great chainsaw that cuts really well it's lightweight very versatile if you can keep the chain it's a great bang for the buck
customer_reviews.author: Bonziamaster

customer_reviews.title: Have several GreenWorks products. Admit I had never used ...
customer_reviews.text: Have several GreenWorks products. Admit I had never used a chainsaw before this one. Written and figure instructions. Strong safety recommendations. Used it to saw up 4 to 6 inch tree limbs after a storm. Confess to being 4 ft. 11 inches tall, 3/4 of a century old and it worked for me.
customer_reviews.author: MKK

customer_reviews.title: Really nice especially for the price
customer_reviews.text: I had an old McCulloch 14" electric chainsaw that worked flawlessly for almost 30 years but the last time I used it the switch was intermittent and the chain oiler was leaking so it was time to finally replace. I hate replacing well made old tools with modern junk but I was pleasantly surprised that this saw was actually pretty nice. I have just occasional need for a chainsaw and much prefer an electric one for smaller jobs when power is available. This seems like it was a good choice.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Light and Easy to Use
customer_reviews.text: I just wanted to prune back my own trees in the front yard. I cut through 4" diameter branches in seconds without having to apply pressure. As many other reviewers mentioned, the chain gets loose pretty quick. I just tightened the screw every few minutes. If I was using this all day on heavy-duty work, this would get old fast, but for cutting down 20 branches in the front yard, it wasn't a problem at all.
customer_reviews.author: Carter Cathey

customer_reviews.title: This is the best electric chain saw I've had.
customer_reviews.text: I'm a wood turner and cut lots of tree trunks and limbs into turning blanks. This chainsaw has shown itself to be the best electric saw I've used. It has a novel chain tightening system which works quite well and makes adjustments to the chain tension very quick. I've only had it a few weeks, but so far, it has performed admirably.
customer_reviews.author: forestturnings

customer_reviews.title: Bad experience, I would not recommend buying.
customer_reviews.text: Bought the GreenWorks electric chain saw for light duty work based on some internet reviews of electric chain saws. Package arrived in good condition. Read the instructions and put oil in the tank, plugged in the cord and squeezed the trigger... Motor ran but chain did not more. Adjusted chain tension as described in the manual, pretty much same result. Chain runs maybe 1 out of 5 attempts. Chain starts with a loud "clunk/jerk" when it does engage.. After running chain for about 30 seconds, noticed the chain was loose and need re-tension adjustment. Chain still runs about 1 time out of 5 attempts. After setting for a day, large amount of oil had leaked out. Returning to Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: TechGeezer

customer_reviews.title: Chain brake does not work properly  chain teeth broke off in first 10 minutes of use
customer_reviews.text: This is the biggest piece of junk I have ever bought from Amazon , Unfortunately I did not have a chance to use before my send it back time expired , so Tough doo doo . After HOURS on hold and waiting for a service rep with no satisfaction . I ordered a new chain from Oregon , hoping I can at least get a little use out of it . as the chain teeth started snapping off on the first use after I figured out how to get the chain brake to work JUNK JUNK JUNK ....
customer_reviews.author: William Blanchard

customer_reviews.title: Good Little Saw
customer_reviews.text: This is an awesome little chain saw. For a first time user, I felt it handles well. I followed all the directions for cutting, and didn't have any problems. I cut limbs with ease, and a small purple plum that had died with the truck of the tree about 4 inches. This is just what I needed and I love it.
customer_reviews.author: CinderellaRN

customer_reviews.title: Warning - if warranty is important to you. But works well for a while.
customer_reviews.text: After about 20 hours use the oil pump stopped working and the oil reservoir never empties any more. = ( I contacted the company for a warranty (I've owned it a couple of months) and never received a reply. For the price - I probably already got my money's worth. I have been using it still but I have to stop and oil the bar and chain every 10 minutes or so.
customer_reviews.author: Ron Kramer

customer_reviews.title: Super Happy with this purchase
customer_reviews.text: I'm so happy I bought this little electric chainsaw. Every year I spend several hours getting my old gas saw running, not to mention the repair time while trying to use it. I only need a saw about 3 times a year, so electric made sense. I have 10 Oleanders in my yard that need trimming each year, I bought this to take them from 15ft tall to two feet tall and it cut through 6" stumps like butter. I was very impressed with the power. I adjusted the chain 3 times over the 3 days it took to clean up the back yard, and used about 6 tanks of oil. I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: phranticness

customer_reviews.title: Have had two that didn't function.
customer_reviews.text: I have had two of these shipped to me. Neither one worked. The second (replacement) chainsaw was an obvious customer return. So if it didn't work for the last guy I don't know what would make them think it would work for me. Too bad, I have several other green works products and have been happy with them which is why I ordered the chainsaw. Changes my view of the company significantly.
customer_reviews.author: Alan R

customer_reviews.title: Very light and easy to control.
customer_reviews.text: I cut down two half dead 15 feet citrus trees with this chainsaw. I had no experience in using a chainsaw before. This tool is very light, easy to handle, no kickback. I feel very confident while using it. The tension did come loose once a while and needed to be readjusted, especially when cutting a big tree trunk. I am less than 100 pounds, 5 ft 2 and almost 60 years old. If I can do it, so should you.
customer_reviews.author: S. Miller

customer_reviews.title: Fit for purpose..
customer_reviews.text: Well gave this saw a good workout this morning having received it Friday. No complaints everything worked as specified and in user manual. Bar oil reservoir operated with no leaks and lubed the bar well (wasn't cutting wood - needed to trim a severely overgrown bird of paradise palm... the saw made quick work of it despite the heavy plant trunks (20 and 30 feet).. Better than average 'made in china" quality for a lower cost corded chain saw for occasional use. Cleanup was simple reassembly as good as other brand-name saws I've owned. Would highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Jim MCO

customer_reviews.title: the second day it started smoking then caught on fire I made sure I had plenty of chain oil did not overexert with too much pres
customer_reviews.text: Avoid this chainsaw at all cost, the first day I had to replace the chain, the second day it started smoking then caught on fire I made sure I had plenty of chain oil did not overexert with too much pressure on cutting the tree pretty much let the chain do all the work but just cutting two trees approximately 12 inches wide 20 feet long the chainsaw is now a $50 paperweight
customer_reviews.author: OfficerJames

customer_reviews.title: I cut ONE branch off a tree, set it ...
customer_reviews.text: I cut ONE branch off a tree, set it down on porch to move the branch, and it wouldn't turn on again... Tried changing outlets, tried changing cords, NOTHING... Just dead... Returned it.
customer_reviews.author: Paul R

customer_reviews.title: Leaks oil live a 70's ford
customer_reviews.text: fine for chainsaw duties, but leaks oil all over the body and drips a huge mess. returned and got the Oregon model with self sharpening stone. The tool less tensioner on the oregon is SO MUCH easier to use, and the chain doesn 't come off constantly like the greenworks. I spent more time reconnecting the chain than cutting wood.
customer_reviews.author: Wayne DeJulia

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase
customer_reviews.text: My husband used it right away! The chain came off, but he said it was easy to get back on. He cleared out some trees around the property. Great purchase - just remember to buy some chain oil / lubricant with your chainsaw.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa

customer_reviews.title: Great chainsaw for small projects
customer_reviews.text: This is a great chainsaw for small projects, but I was also amazed how it performed cutting trees over 7 inches. The cord can be a pain, but operation cost is much less than gas. I considered battery because of the cord, but glad I went with this. I was able to finish quite a bit one day and know a battery would have needed to be charged several times. Quality is also actually very good, especially considering the price.
customer_reviews.author: WillPrimeMem

customer_reviews.title: Lots of good reviews here but the chain dulled really fast after a couple of use
customer_reviews.text: Bought this back in March 2, 2018. Use it to cut some dead nectarine trees. First time using it cut 4-5 inch diameter like butter. But after a couple of use the chain dulled. The design is really good but I think the weakest link is the chain very disappointed. However find out some replacement are only $10 bucks but the reviews says they dull really fast too. So I"m researching for a better chain replacement
customer_reviews.author: Rexxiboy

customer_reviews.title: Works well.
customer_reviews.text: This is no professional model but it held up as I cut down a 15 foot tall tree and several large branches from a very old tree. the chain falls off quickly if you let the chain get dull. but it is very good otherwise and light enough for a olde woman to weild easily.
customer_reviews.author: Sandra Roberts

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use , lightweight,  automatic oil pump . Not a bad product.
customer_reviews.text: I love that it automatically oils itself, it is light weight and easy to use. The cap for the oil Reservoir is held on by a price of string , so that will probably break later on but no big deal . It works and it gets the job done so I'm happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: J. Shook

customer_reviews.title: Love this saw!
customer_reviews.text: This saw is great for the homeowner, It is the perfect saw for downing 20" diameter trees and smaller, and it's "quite". I have had mine for three years and I would put it up against any gaser with an 18" blade. 45 years of experience.
customer_reviews.author: Brdawn

customer_reviews.title: Good enough
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for some very small trees and it worked great for that. Then I had a big tree come down and was debating calling a service or trying to tackle it with this chainsaw and I went ahead and did it. It was probably the max size tree this chainsaw could handle, but it saved me hundreds of dollars. Don't forget to check bar oil frequently on a big job.
customer_reviews.author: ReviewNC

customer_reviews.title: Great Electrical Chainsaw
customer_reviews.text: Easy to setup and use. Operates very smoothly. Chain may come off, especially, if you hit the front with hard wood or if you hit soil but replacing it back is very simple after cleanup of debris and soil. My intended purpose is to grind the stumps under the ground level and thus I am trying to make use of various tools here - it is very hard work (please don't underestimate work involved) that I have compelted about 50% and another 50% yet to get done with grinding of stumps.
customer_reviews.author: PG

customer_reviews.title: A practical and light tool
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a light chainsaw with 16", which is easy and most of all safe to handle. Most chainsaws are heavier and need more force. As I have difficulties to start gas driven, I choosed a cord version. The practical use was impressive good and I can recommend this chainsaw very much.
customer_reviews.author: Klaus D. Weinhold

customer_reviews.title: It runs hot quickly in cold temps despite using a lot of oil, so it cannot be used for a big job.
customer_reviews.text: It bucks up oak great, but... it runs real hot quickly, just about after cutting every round, in 40 degree temps, despite using a lot of oil. So it cannot be used for a big job. I expect it will not last long.
customer_reviews.author: WalksDogsHerdsCats

customer_reviews.title: I love this chain saw.
customer_reviews.text: What a great little chain saw. I am 74 years old and found it very easy to trim trees. Light weight, easy to clean, and very safe to use. It doesn't go through the oil as fast as some of the reviews I read before purchasing it claimed it did. I would definitely recommend this chain saw to anyone for light weight work.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: Used this to cut an oak trunk into splittable sections. To put it simply, it worked like a charm. I never felt like I was pushing it past it’s capacity, and the cuts were nice and smooth. Not having to deal with gas mixing, gas fumes or running out of fuel was an additional perk that can’t be undersold. I’ll eventually get some manner of cordless version for storm cleanup, but for general use, this is all I see myself needing.
customer_reviews.author: TheAngryGinger

customer_reviews.title: Chain keeps coming off...
customer_reviews.text: The chain keeps coming off. It seems well built, though it is what it is. It's not the top of the line so don't expect the best. But if you have a small yard and expect to do only light trimming it should do well. Just be sure you know how to put on the chain repeatedly. Also, it uses a lot of chain oil, so be sure you have a lot of that on hand.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: you get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a means to get rid of a few trees in my yard after the recent hurricanes. shortly after I began using it I realized there is a leak in the oil reservoir . its a slow leak but I managed to finish the job needed and for what I paid for it I feel I got my moneys worth as I don't believe ill have use for it again.
customer_reviews.author: IamBruceWayne

customer_reviews.title: Check chain tension between cuts and it works perfectly.
customer_reviews.text: Priced renting a gas unit for cutting down a smaller tree which burned up my sawsall and found this for just a few dollars more. Reviews seemed good and if you follow the setup instructions and operational instructions, it works like a champ! One tree cut down and cut into pieces for a fire come winter again and it's paid for itself (rental cost plus buying a stack of pre-cut wood)
customer_reviews.author: Tylor richter

customer_reviews.title: A good saw
customer_reviews.text: I used it to remove a tree with about 16 inch diameter. No problem at all. I also uses it to trim other trees and this saw does well. Such a great price and strong...save me a lot of hiring a contractor.
customer_reviews.author: KC

customer_reviews.title: Broke after one use and could not drop off return because of Covid
customer_reviews.text: Was using it for the first time to trim a tree and it broke on the 4th branch. Printed a return label to drop it off at Khols and they wouldn't allow us to drop it off because of Covid. 100% waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: J. Perry

customer_reviews.title: Great product and would buy again!!
customer_reviews.text: Great chain for a great price. Right out of the box and worked 4 hours trimming and cutting down trees. Would highly recommend if you have a lot of trimming to do and cutting tree up to 5 inch in diameter. Did not have any problems so reviews were claiming. Use a good bar oil and check chain tension often.
customer_reviews.author: CHRIS BUCKHOLTZS

customer_reviews.title: great electric chainsaw
customer_reviews.text: received this chainsaw on 1/12/2017 and it has worked excellent. i am now 66 years old and did not want a gas powered chainsaw to use on my property to take down some dead trees. the trunk on one was 36 inches in diameter the saw never lacked power to cut through the wood. one tree was a walnut and the saw worked well on this hardwood. would definitely but again
customer_reviews.author: krom

customer_reviews.title: WOW im inpressed
customer_reviews.text: for the price you cant go wrong, we used this for like 8 hours cutting up Pecan logs into 14" pieces top split for fire wood. had to tension the blade a few time but that's normal, never bogged it down or got hot, this is the saw to buy, just need a 120V outlet and a 14 or 12 gauge cord.
customer_reviews.author: HoneyC

customer_reviews.title: Powerful little bugger.
customer_reviews.text: Awesome little saw. Long bar with plenty of power. Great weight, only thing is it pops the chain a little too often. That might be operator error, but for an electric I'm very impressed with the power.
customer_reviews.author: G-bury

customer_reviews.title: Not powerful enough to be useful.
customer_reviews.text: Avoid this product for any meaningful yardwork. It’s too weak to cut through thicker wood log. All you will cause yourself is a huge vibration. Might as well use those manual saw that you pull the cord on.
customer_reviews.author: Phong Bui

customer_reviews.title: Chain falls off way too often
customer_reviews.text: Chain falls off every few minutes no matter what you do, seems pretty dangerous. Oil flys everywhere mixed with chopped up junk. Box was poorly packed and taped, seems like a refurb. Nope.
customer_reviews.author: Z8

customer_reviews.title: Try to order 2 blades
customer_reviews.text: Blade does not stay sharp long enough to do even small jobs. Had to remove some small branches less than 5 in circumference and it was very hard. The blade was dull after 6-8 branches being cut.
customer_reviews.author: lee reinsmith

customer_reviews.title: Not a great deal
customer_reviews.text: Looked ok. It is now 12 Amps not 9 amps. Bought it because of the warranty of 4 years. It is a lot longer than any others but you have to pay postage to return so it is not that great even with the 4 year warranty. I returned it. I purchased a Harbor Freight one with extend warranty. You can return it in-store and get a new one right away. I used it this weekend and it works great. Buy it with their coupons and their warranty. HF is cheaper in the long run than buying something else and paying postage to use the warranty. I Love HF's electric chainsaw..
customer_reviews.author: kenny

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Great value for a small chainsaw...I would I need anything bigger, not like I’m chasing people while wearing a skin mask...at least I would be following cdc guidelines...lol...jk great product
customer_reviews.author: Robert C. Garcia

customer_reviews.title: Leaks Oil Like Crazy
customer_reviews.text: I've owned it two months now and used it once on the day I received it. Filled it with the recommended oil, used it and cleaned and stored in accordance with the user manual. Looking at it now after 6 weeks in storage, the oil has gone from near full to less than 1/4 tank, with the rest in a pool on the floor of my shed.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel

customer_reviews.title: Surprisingly good.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for $43 here on amazon, because I just wanted to cut down one tree in my yard that would've otherwise cost $250 to have someone do it for me. I wasn't expecting much especially for the price and being electric, but it was surprisingly good. I was able to cut an approximately 10 inch diameter tree trunk in a few minutes without much effort.
customer_reviews.author: Tony J.

customer_reviews.title: It's hard to work with
customer_reviews.text: It is a good machine for its price. A little hard to work with, since the cord is too short,generally the extenion cord gets on the way. The chain comes out very easily.
customer_reviews.author: Ciro Elgueta

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I hesitated on this because I was not familiar with the company but it is the best electric chainsaw I have ever bought. Everything on this chainsaw has been made easy to maintain and make adjustments. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: - ALL (general) PURPOSE -
customer_reviews.text: Not the worst, not the best Not the largest, not the smallest, Not the cheapest, not the most expensive . . . but works if care and caution is used. Requires Specific Oil. Suggests being drained between uses. May bleed oil when in storage / not running. Compare prices.
customer_reviews.author: Concerned Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Very impressed!
customer_reviews.text: Super surprised with the power of this saw. Cut through 8-10" limbs with no effort at all. I love it! Eats oil but who cares, its quiet, powerful and I don't have another gas engine to maintain. How could I forget the price, awesome price compared to its battery competitors. If I need to cut far from an outlet I can use my portable generator.
customer_reviews.author: Felipe

customer_reviews.title: If you are cutting anything larger than 6" I would recommend something else
customer_reviews.text: Right out of the box, I had a issue with the chain coming off. If you are cutting anything larger than 6" I would recommend something else. It does a good job lubing the chain as you cutting. So much so that it actually makes a mess. I would recommend use on only small jobs.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: We've gotten quite a bit of use out of this ...
customer_reviews.text: We've gotten quite a bit of use out of this and no problems :) Do yourself a favor and order the oil when you order the chainsaw. It was kind of a pain to find locally. The biggest problem was locating the oil in the store!
customer_reviews.author: Wendy Jarvis

customer_reviews.title: Texas chainsaw massacre posponed till the power comes back on
customer_reviews.text: I am so sick of 2 cycle stuff that the fuel lines, bubble rot off of the 3rd time you use it. This little power house downed and dissected a big magnolia tree in one meal. Couldnt ask for more, love GreenWorks products
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Gibson

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Value
customer_reviews.text: Bought this chainsaw as an alternative to renting one from Home Depot. Wow, this thing just chews through anything from 4" to 8" branches (didn't have anything larger to try). Absolutely simple to setup and use and I haven't owned a chainsaw in the past. Seems to be well built with a metal chain drive gear. Greenworks has a nice web site too. I wasn't able to determine where the chainsaw was designed and built, but it did NOT seem like the typical poor quality junk that comes from China. Greenworks has a complete line of DIY tools which I will consider for other needs.
customer_reviews.author: tristine schmidt

customer_reviews.title: very powerful electric chainsaw
customer_reviews.text: You cannot go wrong for this price of this product. It is the most powerful electric chainsaw I have used and at a price much cheaper than some of the competitors. Perfect for the homeowner such as myself that needs to cut down the occasional tree or just do some trimming in the yard.
customer_reviews.author: dk

customer_reviews.title: Good Value
customer_reviews.text: So simple a child can use it, but I wouldn’t recommend it since it’s wicked sharp. Easy to adjust chain tension with a simple knob, easy to reattach chain if needed, even a non-mechanical mind like mine figured it out in mere minutes.
customer_reviews.author: NightShifter

customer_reviews.title: Always starts when you squeeze the trigger!
customer_reviews.text: Great for light trimming and although it can cut wood up to 14 inches in diameter it would take just a little longer than a gas saw with same size bar.
customer_reviews.author: Timothy J.

customer_reviews.title: Product leaks oil like crazy
customer_reviews.text: Had a problem with chainsaw leaking oil. Tried to give the manufacturer the benefit of the doubt and contacted them directly. Waited 2 months for a response, hence well beyond the Amazon return date. After sending all the required info, I was told that leaking oil was "normal" for the product and not to fill the oil more than 1/2 way. Buyer beware, product is below average and the Greenworks company is even worse
customer_reviews.author: Robert Landsman

customer_reviews.title: Great power.  Easy to use and operate
customer_reviews.text: Great powerful chainsaw. We trimmed up some trees around the house and cut a 12inch diameter limb with ease, then cut that up into smaller managable pieces. Zero issues. We had a gas chainsaw but every time we needed it, it would be difficult to start or keep running.
customer_reviews.author: Tom K.

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, lightweight, perfect for me
customer_reviews.text: This chainsaw is easy to use. Lightweight. I don't know how it would handle bigger jobs but it worked perfectly for my small jobs. One cautionary note always pick it up by the left handle. It's easy to press the two buttons to activate it when you pick it up by the right handle.
customer_reviews.author: Marian P Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Chain
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for me. However the chain jumps off frequently. It's a handy lil guy. I cut down a few over grown bushes in my backyard. I'm a female and it handles well.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not heavy, easy to use
customer_reviews.text: My new favorite tool. I’m small and female, and it’s just what I was looking for. Good price too. Works great, easy to use and I like that it’s electric and not gas.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Exceeded my expectations
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to replace my craftsman gas chain saw. Wasn’t sure how it would handle a fairly large tree that had fallen. The tree was approximately 10 inches circumference and maybe 18 feet tall. . The Greenworks saw worked much better then expected. I took it out of the box, put some chain oil in and started to work. It cut through the trunk with no problem. I had to stop once to add some more chain oil and slightly tighten the blade but other than that it was relatively quick work. I am very pleased and would recommend this saw to anyone to use on small to midsize trees.
customer_reviews.author: charlie  king

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased with purchase
customer_reviews.text: I needed a bigger chainsaw for a large tree. This was reasonably priced and not as familiar brand so I wondered about the quality. While not apples to apples, compared to my smaller saw this is great quality, hefty, and easy to use. It’s especially much easier to tighten the chain and even remove the cover to re-attach it when it catches and slips off.
customer_reviews.author: the jetsons

customer_reviews.title: Chain Came Off
customer_reviews.text: Replacing chain blade into position is almost impossible. A very poor design of adjustment features. A bad buy.
customer_reviews.author: MLB

customer_reviews.title: Uses a lot of oil.
customer_reviews.text: Chainsaw works but uses a ton of oil. The chain it comes with is not very durablle and needed to be sharpened after 1 small tree. For this price range I would recommend a Sun Joe and not this one.
customer_reviews.author: Samuel Lee

customer_reviews.title: This chainsaw really cuts!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve used this chainsaw on 3 different occasions and it has come in clutch everytime. I don’t anticipate using this chainsaw very often, so I better about this purchase than a gas mower. Had the chain jump the the bar the second time I used it and it wasn’t too complicated to fix and get back in action.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. William R

customer_reviews.title: Great around the house.
customer_reviews.text: No more yanky, yanky- maybe cranky. I'm disabled and this is a good saw around the house. I have 3 gas-powered saws, and due to in-frequent use, neither will crank. Just check bar oil, and plug this baby in. Not as fast, but neither am I.
customer_reviews.author: Richard P McLeland Jr

customer_reviews.title: Horrible product with cheap plastic!
customer_reviews.text: Cheap plastic tensioner. It will not tighten the chain. Chain keeps on getting off track. First time used it for a few minutes and after one 5in diameter branch the chain stopped staying in place.
customer_reviews.author: Rod T.

customer_reviews.title: Great power for the price
customer_reviews.text: For the price this is an amazing tool. Cut up several down fir trees in excess of the length of the bar. Quiet, good power. Upgrade the chain after tile original wears out and keep going. Save the expensive gas work for when you are not within range of a plug.
customer_reviews.author: Deep State Operative

customer_reviews.title: It works ok. I actually used the first one ...
customer_reviews.text: It works ok. I actually used the first one up cutting up a few limbs and they replaced it without any problems. The second one is ok. If you have a very big project I would go with a gas powered. This would be ok to cut up shrubs in your yard.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth Judy

customer_reviews.title: Mine doesn't leak oil
customer_reviews.text: 72 year old female--no problem to use. Powerful enough to zip through small 4-6" tree trunks. don't have anything larger to cut right now. Not too heavy for me.
customer_reviews.author: woodwind

customer_reviews.title: Died after 2 trees
customer_reviews.text: An ok chainsaw when it worked, but lasted less than six months. Cut down 1 medium sized pine tree, and was working on one small pepper tree, but motor burnt out before I finished. Contacted manufacturer over a month ago, have yet to receive a response. Maybe ok for cutting branches once in awhile, but not up to cutting trees.
customer_reviews.author: TJ

customer_reviews.title: Nice Size Saw
customer_reviews.text: I haven't had to use the saw yet but it is a nice size. Really need to use it but cannot make my mind up what to saw first, but will eventually get it out and use. Ordered it for the just in case I need a saw.
customer_reviews.author: Sondra's Opinion

customer_reviews.title: Chain falls off constantly
customer_reviews.text: The chain saw worked great for the first 5 minutes thereafter it went downhill, I spent more time putting the loose on chain on and off. Had to return defective product back.
customer_reviews.author: James B Lee

customer_reviews.title: Very helpful
customer_reviews.text: Just what i needed to trim yard trees/branches. Being a live alone woman and do my own yard work this helps tremendously.
customer_reviews.author: CAROLYN LANCASTER

customer_reviews.title: so far so good!
customer_reviews.text: used the saw to cut up a pile of big and small branches that came off in a wind storm.. I have had two Remington electric saws, and so far this one seems to cut much better.. will repost if anything changes..
customer_reviews.author: Mary Ann Oakland

customer_reviews.title: Very impressed with the power this chainsaw packs
customer_reviews.text: This is an awesome electric chainsaw. I have two smaller 14inch units but needed something bigger for larger tree branches. All I had to do is add chain lubricant and I was ready to go. This thing sliced through some pretty large branches like butter. I highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Jose

customer_reviews.title: Cuts fast
customer_reviews.text: Only have used it once so far. But it cuts really fast. I am amazed at how fast it went thru the tree limbs.
customer_reviews.author: Aircooled VW's of the USA

customer_reviews.title: Great product for the money
customer_reviews.text: It's the right size for me; easy to handle. I've had to use it for everything from trimming trees in my yard to trimming back the limbs and branches of a very big live oak tree (not down to the trunk). Had no problems doing any of it. I'm a female in my 60s and was able to use it. Would recommend this for anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Karen

customer_reviews.title: Pretty worthless
customer_reviews.text: Motor seized after 1 hour trimming small branches. Chain had a problem staying in its track before failure, despite adjusting tension. This thing is a bad joke, don't waste your money.
customer_reviews.author: Kristy D Walden

customer_reviews.title: Worked well, tree gone
customer_reviews.text: This little tool helped me down a full size basswood tree, trunk and all. Nice and lightweight. Warning says you should never climb a ladder with a chainsaw, but how else you going to get the tree down? Must be durable, because it still works perfectly!
customer_reviews.author: B. Watson

product_meta.title: Greenworks 20222 Electric Chainsaw, 14-Inch
product_meta.description: Size:14-Inch| Style:10.5 AmpGreenWorks offer a range of systems to choose from in corded & Cordless tools. Leading in innovation, the corded lawn system offers a variety of tools to get all your yd work done quickly & efficiently. Whether you need something economical or with greater performance, The GreenWorks Corded lawn tools provide reliable options without the hassle of gas or the high cost of operation throughout the years. Get started within S & leave the gas hassle behind. Choose from trimmers, chainsaws, mowers, snow throwers, Dethatchers, pressure washers & more-all GreenWorks corded lawn tools are backed by a 4 year warranty. For a cordless option, Check out GreenWorks g-20v, g-24v & G-MAX 40V tools.
feature_bullets: 10.5 amp electric motor starts within seconds for ease of use and Reliable power
14-Inch Bar makes clean up jobs a breeze
Tool-less chain tensioning for quick adjustments so you can get back to the task at hand
Wrap around handle provides user comfort while clearing debris. Translucent oil tank for clear view of oil level
Auto-oiler provides adequate Lubrication to ensure the best cutting performance without the hassle

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.2 out of 5 stars822 ratings4.2 out of 5 stars
